more than 1 billion people in the world are
obese. It is alarming that the number of obese people
has increased fourfold.  Since 1990, the
world's current population is over 8
billion people, but it is estimated that more than 1 billion people
are obese, which is at risk of leading to many
serious health problems. This is
one of the independent studies.  is
considered the most reliable
ever based on data from more than 220
million people in 190 countries and
territories. According to research, the proportion of obese people is
now more common than the proportion of malnourished people
in most of the world.  Most countries,
including low- and middle-income countries,
face
food shortages. More than 50 countries and
territories have combined rates of malnutrition and obesity
above 40 minutes, meaning nearly  Half of the
population will be nutritionally imbalanced between
1990 and 2022. Obesity rates will
double in adults and quadruple in
children, while
malnutrition will only moderately decrease.
Obesity and malnutrition both have
health effects. Obesity comes
with the risk of early death or
complications of diabetes and heart disease,
while nutrition is detrimental to
children's development.
